titlestmt.titleproper: Lexington, Kentucky, City-County Planning Commission records
Guide to the Lexington, Kentucky, City-County Planning Commission records, 1928-1974, undated M-642
titlestmt.author: Revised by Kaitlyn Moran

publicationstmt.publisher: University of Kentucky Special Collections Research Center

repository.corpname: University of Kentucky Special Collections Research Center

did.unittitle: Lexington, Kentucky, City-County Planning Commission records
did.abstract: The Lexington, Kentucky, City-County Planning Commission records (dated 1928-1974; 2.88 cubic feet; 35 reels) consist of microfilmed copies of records created by the commission documenting the development of Lexington.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open to researchers by appointment.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: City-County Planning Commission, Lexington, Ky. Loan while microfilming, April, 1966; Oct, 1967; August, 1969; July, 1970; August, 1971; October, 1972, June, 1975.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Collection is arranged in five series: Board of Adjustment Minutes, Minutes, Past Planning Studies, Publications, Neighborhood Plans, and Scrapbooks. Within each series records are in chrological order.

bioghist.head: Historical note
bioghist.p: The City Planning and Zoning Commission was established in Lexington in 1928. Its jurisdiction was extended throughout Fayette County in 1948 and its name was changed to the City-County Planning and Zoning Commission. Ten years later, the commission adopted the name, City-County Planning Commission and later became part of the new urban county government.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: M-642: [Identification of item], Lexington, Kentucky, City-County Planning Commission records, 1928-1974, undated, University of Kentucky Libraries Special Collections Research Center.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Lexington, Kentucky, City-County Planning Commission records (dated 1928-1974; 2.88 cubic feet; 35 reels) consist of microfilmed copies of records created by the commission documenting the development of Lexington. The records include commission minutes from 1928 to 1973; Board of Adjustment minutes 1928 to 1973; past planning studies issued from 1931 to 1966; and research reports (1963- 1964). There are also copies of zoning ordinances of the 1960s and 1970s, maps, atlases, scrapbooks, neighborhood plans, and publications.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The physical rights to these materials are held by University of Kentucky Special Collections Research Center.
